header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 163
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setian Philosophy, Practical Magic, Community Insights

central_thesis: This issue of The Scroll of Set provides diverse perspectives on the practical, philosophical, and communal aspects of Setian initiation, emphasizing Xeper as an ongoing process fostered through ethical interactions, specific magical practices (like exploring 'death as transition' or 'walking in other worlds'), the integration of the Feminine Dæmonic, critical self-assessment at all initiatory degrees, and the transformative power of Setian gatherings ('Black Hajj').

structure_content.chapter_title: On Humor and Courtesy at Setian Gatherings
structure_content.summary: This article advocates for the importance of honesty, mutual respect, and appropriate humor within Setian gatherings and interactions to facilitate Xeper and maintain the Temple's Protocol. It provides guidelines for handling diverse senses of humor and avoiding friction, stressing the ethical necessity of clear communication for Initiates.

This article offers a Setian-centric review of the 1999 film 'The Mummy', praising its portrayal of ancient Egyptian grandeur and identifying themes that resonate with or contradict the Setian worldview. The author critiques 'Book of Exodus PCism' in cinema and re-contextualizes Imhotep as a High Priest of Set.

This article describes a Setian initiatory order focused on exploring 'Death as transition' through operative and illustrative methods. Amenta is defined as a psychological underworld ruled by Set, where 'death' is a state of metamorphosis used as a tool for Xeper to refine individual qualities and facilitate Becoming. Membership is by invitation, aimed at developing LHP necromancers.

This article announces the formation of the Berserker Guild, open to II°+ Initiates, dedicated to establishing a Black Magical warrior tradition within the Temple of Set. It integrates martial arts with Xeper, utilizing publications like 'Black Dragon' and offering warrior craft workshops through the Pylon system.

This article connects Carlos Castaneda's Nagualism to Setian philosophy, emphasizing the reversal of 'crippling effects of socialization' through 'antinomian not-doings'. These practices, including recapitulation and magical passes, reclaim dispersed energy, perfect 'isolate intelligence', and enable one to 'dart past the eagle' (death) for ultimate freedom, aligning with Xeper and Remanifestation.

structure_content.chapter_title: A Note of Appreciation to Those Attending the Los Angeles Gathering
structure_content.summary: This article is a personal reflection on the Los Angeles Gathering, highlighting it as a profound initiatory experience. The author describes deep connections with other Initiates, personal realizations gained by embracing the 'black void' or 'dark mistress of the psyche', and a strengthened allegiance to Set and the Temple.

This article presents a practical magical system distinct from typical 'astral plane' work, drawing on Celtic cosmology. It outlines a structured practice of taking physical journeys with magical intention, observing details, journaling, and mythologizing experiences to explore other realities, gain insights, and enhance Xeper.

structure_content.chapter_title: Conflict and Camaraderie at the Mid-Year Gathering
structure_content.summary: This article discusses the dynamics of Setian gatherings, asserting that the 'motley crew' nature of Initiates and even healthy conflict contribute significantly to creativity, deepen individual and collective Xeper, and foster valuable magical alliances. It emphasizes the transformative power of direct interaction at conclaves.

This article argues for the philosophical and practical value of humor in Setian interactions, viewing it as a rational, energy-releasing 'ventilator' and a means to foster 'metaphysical friendship'. It connects humor to the archetype of the Fool and its role in navigating initiatory paths and contacting one's creative center.
This is an event announcement for a regional Setian gathering hosted by the Gates of Ganzir Pylon in Brighton, inviting members to attend or present.
This is an announcement regarding the availability of the second, 'debugged' German translation of The Crystal Tablet of Set for German-speaking Initiates.

This article from the High Priest of Set provides directives for a Temple-wide 'Essential Working' and analyzes the practical aspects of the Fourth and First Degrees of initiation. It defines magic, concentration, mindfulness, and the process of overcoming 'fetters', concluding with a recommendation for a 'Setian Hajj' to conclaves as an essential initiatory 'sacrament of Set'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Feminine Dæmonic: The Mysteries of Babalon in the Æon of Set
structure_content.summary: This comprehensive analysis advocates for the reintroduction and integration of the Feminine Dæmonic (Babalon) as a crucial, often distorted, principle of the Left-Hand Path. It critiques modern misinterpretations of the Goddess, re-contextualizes æonic succession to include a 'Babalon Æon' initiated by Parsons, and details the Babalon Pylon's work in employing invocation, Tantric concepts, and physical self-deification.

This article announces the Babalon Pylon's first publication, 'Scarlet Letters, Book One', an illustrated anthology featuring essays and accounts of Feminine Dæmonic workings, designed to make this current accessible to Setians. It also mentions a supplemental introductory text, 'The Gates of Babalon'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Spiral Maze of Thulask: The Psychology of a Setian's Possible Entertainment
structure_content.summary: This article reviews various experimental music artists (Steve Roach/Vir Unis, Faust, Roger Eno), recommending their works – encompassing ambient, techno, and industrial styles – as suitable 'working music' or tools for inducing introspective states conducive to Setian Xeper and psychology.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Setian Hajj: The Los Angeles Gathering, Conclaves, and the Year of the Essential
structure_content.summary: This article details how Setian conclaves function as a 'Setian Hajj' – a transformative pilgrimage essential for 'hyper-Xeper', forming Black Magical alliances, and integrating the Xepera Xeper Xeperu formula. It advocates for a mandatory pilgrimage for Initiates, highlighting the profound personal change it facilitates.

key_concepts.definition: The central Setian principle of self-creation, becoming, and evolution of consciousness, constantly referenced as the core goal of all Setian practices and gatherings.

A cosmic, non-biological energy and fundamental principle of the Left-Hand Path, distinct from mundane gender, seen as Set's feminine counterpart, essential for Black Magic and enhancing the Æon of Set.
The 'Hidden Land' (Egyptian underworld) reinterpreted as a Setian concept where 'death' is a state of transition and essential metamorphosis, used as a tool for Xeper.
Practices, derived from Nagualism, that defy social expectations to reclaim dispersed energy and facilitate isolate intelligence for self-liberation.
A state of perfected awareness and consciousness, achieved through reclaiming energy and reversing socialization, allowing one to 'dart past the eagle' (death) and achieve freedom.

A proposed mandatory pilgrimage for Setians to attend a conclave or gathering within their first three years, considered an essential 'sacrament of Set' for profound personal transformation, embodying the Xepera Xeper Xeperu formula.
Formal guidelines for ethical and clear communication and interaction within the Temple of Set, especially for Initiates.

The degree of Master, defined by the practical application of magic (subjective to objective universe change), internalized states of concentration and mindfulness, and the ability to objectively evaluate and overcome personal 'fetters' and challenges.

The initial stage of Setian initiation, where 'study of the Crystal Tablet' means practical self-change and overcoming personal 'fetters' through direct magical 'lab work' using self-chosen goals for Xeper.
Specific types of music (e.g., ambient, industrial, experimental) used as tools to create atmospheres, facilitate magical workings, or induce introspective states conducive to Xeper.
Carlos Castaneda's metaphor for the cosmic force that devours the awareness of all living beings upon death; the ultimate goal is to transcend this force through perfected isolate intelligence.

practical_system.description: The collected articles present a multi-faceted approach to Setian Black Magic and personal Xeper. This includes: structured social protocols and humor guidelines for effective group dynamics; initiatory orders focused on specific transformative themes (e.g., 'Death as transition' in the Obsidian Sepulcher of Amenta, martial arts in the Berserker Guild); practical energy work inspired by Nagualism (recapitulation, magical passes); imaginative exploration of other realities ('Walking In Other Worlds'); the integration of the Feminine Dæmonic (Babalon) through invocation, Tantric concepts, and physical self-deification; and the mandatory 'Setian Hajj' to conclaves for accelerated Xeper.
tools: Temple Protocol (guidelines for social interaction and communication)
Journals (for recording and mythologizing experiences, particularly in 'Walking In Other Worlds')
The body (utilized in magical passes, Tantric practices, and as a magical tool)
Bindrunes (used for First Degree practical magic, e.g., to address lack of confidence)
Specific music albums (e.g., Steve Roach, Faust, Roger Eno, recommended as 'working music')
The Crystal Tablet of Set (a foundational text serving as a guide for Initiates, particularly in the First Degree)
Personal will and focused awareness (fundamental for all Setian magical operations and Xeper)
Communal interaction and discourse (at gatherings, essential for 'hyper-Xeper' and forming alliances)
Philosophical understanding of archetypes (e.g., The Fool, for integrating humor into initiatory paths)
rituals: Essential Working (Temple-wide solitary ritual on North Solstice to strengthen a chosen aspect of the Temple)
Recapitulation (Nagualism, reliving interpersonal encounters to recover energy)
Magical Passes (Nagualism, specific physical movements to recover dispersed energy)
Walking In Other Worlds (physical journey with stated magical intention, followed by detailed journaling and mythologizing for insights)
Invocation and Evocation of the Goddess (Feminine Dæmonic practices by the Babalon Pylon)
Tantric concepts (Kundalini awakening, erotic magic, physical systems of self-deification, as explored by the Babalon Pylon)
Self-chosen goals for Xeper (practical 'lab work' for First Degree Initiates, focusing on self-change and overcoming 'fetters')
Group workings at conclaves/gatherings (collective magical operations, often with themes like invoking the Feminine Dæmonic or the Principle of War)
Attending Setian conclaves ('Setian Hajj', viewed as a transformative pilgrimage and essential sacrament)

relevant_quotes.text: If it's not fun, it's not the Temple of Set.
The simplest idea of the Temple is that magic is the changing of the subjective universe so that a change in the objective universe occurs in proportion to the precision and passion of the operator.
The Setian discovers that he has forged his own fetters, and that if those fetters are removed, the way of power is opened.
She is a power with which all Black Magicians, regardless of gender, work. The Feminine Dæmonic is every bit as important to the male Black Magician as She is to the female.
Das Ewig Weiblich zieht uns immer hinan.” (“The Eternal Feminine draws us forever onwards.”)
The “Black Hajj” provides infinitely more for the Setian's spirituality than any other form of initiatory exchange in the Temple. Attend one and see for yourself; Remanifest guaranteed.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of The Scroll of Set is highly relevant for practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism, especially those within the Left-Hand Path tradition and the Temple of Set. It offers practical guidelines for social interaction and magical ethics, deep philosophical discussions on core Setian concepts (Xeper, degrees of initiation), and introduces new or re-contextualized systems like the Feminine Dæmonic (Babalon), Nagualism for energy work, and 'Death as Transition'. The emphasis on personal transformation, self-honesty, and the value of community gatherings provides both theoretical depth and actionable advice for initiatory progress.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily members and prospective members of the Temple of Set, ranging from new Initiates (I°) to advanced Adepts (IV°+). It also appeals to external scholars and practitioners interested in modern Left-Hand Path philosophy, gender dynamics in occultism, and the practical application of esoteric principles for self-transformation.
